newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Schuttersveld says net profit up in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Schuttersveld says net profit up in 1996.

text.p: Dutch industrial and services group Schuttersveld Holding NV said on Monday the company had lived up to its promises by posting a 1996 net profit above 1995's 25.2 million guilders.
However, the company will not give a precise figures until March 13.

In November last year, Schuttersveld released earnings figures for the first three quarters of 1996 showing a 13 percent year on year increase in net profit to 18.3 million guilders and said it expected net profit for the full year to be above 1995.
Although some 30 percent of turnover is generated in the sluggish German economy, the company is upbeat about its prospects for this year.
"There is no reason to believe that Schuttersveld's healthy trend of the recent years will suddenly show a reverse in 1997," Jan Wolters, chairman of directors at Schuttersveld, told a press lunch.
He said Schuttersveld will pursue its growth strategy in 1997 by, among other things, acquisitions, adding that he foresaw a very bright future for the company, both within and outside Europe.
